snippet: Pamela B. Gann, president of Claremont McKenna College, discusses the circumstances surrounding the submission of inaccurate SAT data and how her school can regain trust.
abstract: Pamela B. Gann, president of Claremont McKenna College, discusses the circumstances surrounding the submission of inaccurate SAT data and how her school can regain trust.
lead_paragraph: Claremont McKenna College gave too much authority over reporting test scores to a single individual without proper controls, the college's president, Pamela B. Gann, said Thursday in her first interview since it was revealed that Claremont McKenna had submitted manipulated SAT data to ratings agencies for six years.

headline.main: Claremont's President Says Lack of Proper Controls Led to SAT Misinformation
